item.description: Renowned physicist shares thoughts on God, fatherly advice in ABC News interview.

item.title: [+1699] The Exact Floorplan of Dunder Mifflin (PIC)
item.description: Ever wonder how exactly Dunder Mifflin is laid out? No? Well screw you, I have, and I think this is pretty damn cool.

item.title: [+1500] xkcd: Swimsuit Issue
[+1323] Super Mario Killed by BP! (image)
item.description: This may be funny and tragic at the same time, but I gotta hand it to zero-lives for the creative thought and image.

item.title: [+1245] Maybe This Is Why Blockbuster Is Dying
item.description: When your CEO thinks popping the Netflix disc in the Wii is more difficult than driving to a store to physically rent a disc (and then returning said disc), that might be a sign that your company isn't exactly forward-thinking.

item.title: [+1169] The REAL World Record For Parking Like A Douche [PIC]
item.description: Which goes to prove that people who call [insert german expensive car] owners jerks might possibly have a good reason to do so.

item.title: [+1133] Why Old People Shouldnt Use The Internet!
item.description: While I do think the tech support guy could've been more helpful, the call below is priceless. Check it out:

item.title: [+1062] Digg’s Looking For A New CEO
item.description: Rose went on to give a pretty detailed overview of his experiences so far . The role seems to be taking its toll, the words “nightmare” and “stressed” cropped up a couple of times but he does also say it “feels really good.”

item.title: [+1061] Designing A New Logo For BP [pics]
item.description: In response to the Gulf Coast disaster, the BP logo has been redesigned to be more reflective of BP's current business practices.

item.title: [+974] This is my motivation to go to the Gym (Pic)
[+805] Glenn Beck promotes book rife with anti-Semitism and racism
item.description: Glenn Beck promoted The Red Network: A "Who's Who" and Handbook of Radicalism for Patriots, stating that the book is "from people who were doing what we're doing now." However, the book's author, Elizabeth Dilling, was a virulent anti-Semite, and The Red Network itself contains numerous passages that espouse anti-Semitism and racism.

item.title: [+779] CNN uncovers BP cutting corners on day of explosion
item.description: The morning the Deepwater Horizon oil rig exploded, a BP executive and a Transocean official argued over how to proceed with the drilling. The BP official wanted workers to replace heavy mud, used to keep the well's pressure down, with lighter seawater to help speed a process that was costing an estimated $750,000 a day.

item.title: [+699] Homo sex is... SIN
[+696] BP Could Go Bankrupt Over Gulf Spill
item.description: Photo via Autoblog Green So far in its coverage of the BP Gulf spill, the media has made much of the fact that the company's daily profits are higher than its daily cleanup costs, and that after raking in $17 billion in profits last year alone, such costs are but a drop in the bucket.

item.title: [+615] Josh Levy: iPhone 4: Now with Price Gouging! (AT&T)
item.description: Yay, the iPhone 4 is here. But today, instead of thinking about the latest version of the game-changing smartphone, I'm mourning the end of the era of the unlimited data plan.

item.title: [+592] How the White House uses the iPad
item.description: The folks who gather early every morning in the West Wing office of White House Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel have something new in common these days. Practically everyone has an iPad -- or will have one very soon.

item.title: [+591] Google Introduces New Search Index: Caffine
item.description: Today, we're announcing the completion of a new web indexing system called Caffeine. Caffeine provides 50 percent fresher results for web searches than our last index, and it's the largest collection of web content we've offered. Whether it's a news story, a blog or a forum post....
